intro: Sphenostylis erecta subsp. erecta, commonly known as the African milk tree, is a deciduous shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and alternate, pinnately compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in panicles, followed by orange-red berries containing seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional uses in local medicine.
